Molly Meltsner, a daughter of Heli and Michael Meltsner of Cambridge, Mass., and Kenneth Barclay Troop, a son of Melinda Wells and Marc Troop, both of Chicago, were married yesterday. The Rev. Martha Niebanck, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at the summer home of the bride's family in Rockport, Mass.
The couple graduated from Carleton College in Northfield, Minn., the bride magna cum laude.

Ms. Meltsner, 28, will keep her name. She is to begin a one-year master's degree program in the fall at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. She is on leave from the Wayland (Mass.) Middle School, where she teaches seventh-grade English; she also taught English to seventh graders in Houston, where from 1995 to 1997 she was a member of Teach for America.

Her father is a visiting professor of law at Harvard; he is on leave as the George J. and Kathleen Waters Matthews Distinguished University Professor of Law at Northeastern University in Boston. Her mother is a freelance architectural historian and preservation consultant. The bride is a great-great-granddaughter of Joseph Spiegel, founder of the Spiegel Company, the Chicago mail-order concern. Her grandfather the late Dr. John P. Spiegel was a president of the American Psychiatric Association, known for his work on combat fatigue and urban violence.

The bridegroom, 27, is a computer game designer for Turbine Entertainment Software in Westwood, Mass. His father is the president and owner of the M. T. Dairy Service, a Chicago food wholesaler for restaurants and hotels.
